data.title: A great find!
data.text: We have eaten downtown frequently and I thought at nearly every restaurant so I was surprised when a friend recommended we try Bruno's.  It is a small space but has a great atmosphere because of the interaction with people.  There is also a small outdoor area.  We had a great experience.  Owners, husband and wife, are on site serving, cooking and have created a dining experience that we look forward to experience often.  All of the food was amazing but the meatball appetizer tasted straight from Italy!

data.title: "Excellent food with a variety of options!"
data.text: Please take note of some of the reviews that you are reading. Most of the complaints are about the service and not the food itself. Granted, the service may be slower during peak times, but stop and think why. Any restaurant that serves food like this is bound to be busy. The food here is excellent and I will share my experiences with this establishment. I went one night for take-out and the place was packed. There were people standing outside waiting to get in. The food was excellent and I had to experience other dishes while eating at the restaurant. I decided to go at 1130 am for an early lunch and there were only two other patrons at this time. This gave me a perfect opportunity to experience the menu and offer a fair and accurate review. The menu has several options and the recipes are from the Southern region of Italy. Cal Bruno and his wife were both at the restaurant during my visit. Being a native New Yorker, I had the pleasure of speaking with them and learning about their history. Mr. Bruno cooked my meal after the prep work was initiated by one of his line cooks. From start to finish, the owners interacted with me and shared a lot about themselves. The food is absolutely phenomenal! Everything was hot and fresh when it was served. The ingredients as well as the preparation of the meal were within view the entire time. This couple really takes the time to ensure that you have a good experience as well as an excellent meal. I understand that everyone is entitled to their opinion when it comes to a review, but take some of them at face value. Try this place earlier in the day and eat the food before you read or write a review. If you truly value a great meal, you will have the patience to deal with minor issues as some have previously complained about. Leaving one or two stars because you had to wait and didn't even eat the food creates an injustice for this restaurant. You have to give this restaurant a try and see it for yourself firsthand. Please note that this a fair and unbiased review and was written without any influence or coercion. I will eat here as often as I can and every time I visit the Lee County area. Hands down, and in my opinion, the absolute best location for Italian cuisine in Southern Florida.

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text:
Last week my daughter and I went to Bruno's for a late Saturday night dinner.  We had 8:30 reservations and were seated immediately directly across from the cooking area.   It's a very small restaurant, and the open kitchen occupies about 1/2 of the space.  When I walked in I expected it to be really noisy due to the size and since it was at capacity; however, we were able to carry on a conversation with out a problem.

We were waited on by Genevieve Bruno, who is one of the owners and a young assistant, and they provided amazing service.  We started splitting the olive salad and a Caprese.  The olives were great, but they gave us such a large portion we took most of them home.  For entree's I had the cheese ravioli with meatballs and a my daughter had a shrimp special both were 5 star dishes.   For desert we and the vanilla bean ice cream with cannoli crème - tasty and big enough to share.

The cost of the meal wasn't outlandish considering the attentive service and quality of the food.  We will definitely return to this restaurant soon!!!

data.title: Classy on Second Street
data.text: We had the pleasure of eating at Bruno's of Brooklyn for the first time. The menu offered an excellent selection. The service was superb!  All staff and owner was attentive and sought to make our dining experience perfect. Our dinners were excellent too. Although the place is small with very limited outdoor seating, it's worth going. We definitely will go back. I suggest making reservations to insure seating. What a delightful find!

data.title: lunch with friend
data.text: food was well prepared fresh and filling would come back in a heartbeat,food is to die for,chef will cook anything you ask for,small little place ,you need to make a reservation,husband and wife lovely people can't wait to return,good fresh food is not cheap trust me this aint olive garden!

data.title: Excellent meal
data.text: Arrived without reservations so we were seated at the "kitchen counter" which we soon discovered was the best seat in the place.  We were so close we could reach out and touch the cooks.  It was fascinating to watch them prepare our meals.  And during the slow times (which did not last long) we had a great conversation with Bruno (the chef) and his wife (the server). Every thing we ate was superb.  We just wished we lived in Ft. Myers so we could come back soon and often.

data.title: Worth a visit
data.text: We had dinner reservations and were urged to sit at the bar so as to watch the chefs cook.  This wouldn't have occurred to me, but the place is small and space is at a premium.  However, the food is very tasty and well-prepared, and the service is exceptional and friendly.  They clearly take pride in their place.

data.title: just like grandma's
data.text: amazing----very small space but great. the owners are on premise ,cook ,server and very friendly The food was excellent,great home made pasta ( macaroni) I ordered a dish that was not on the menu, no problem it was excellent maybe better than grandma's. If you are going for dinner make a reservation. The times we were there we all ordered a different dish ,all were delicious I' ll be back .

data.title: Well worth it
data.text: small place, good food, good service, staff was fun and on the ball!! well lets say on the meat ball.(good night everybody!)

data.title: Not really good
data.text: Went here for lunch.  I had a sausage and peppers hero and a side of meatballs.  The bread was hard and very chewy.  The sausage had good flavor but the onions weren't cooked enough they were too hard.  The one sliver of a pepper that I found tasted good.  This hero is prepared so you really can't eat it like a hero.  It's more like sausage with a side of bread.  The meatballs are not good.  With huge chunks of onion and fell apart the minute my fork touched.  Here's the kicker, I ordered a slice of Juniors cheesecake for $10.  Well I grew up on Junior's cheesecake and can tell you this was NOT Junior's!  Juniors does not have crust and it almost white in color not yellow with cinnamon crust.  And to charge$10 for that?  Will never go back.  Very disappointed.  Saw this place on the News and thought maybe this was a good place since it's hard to find a good Italian restaurant around here.  Nope I was wrong nothing like a real Brooklyn NY restaurant.

data.title: Near by little gem
data.text: We live maybe 4 blocks away ... Passed this little place often. Yet hadn't stopped in ... Boy were we glad we did ! Beautiful decor, super friendly staff, like being in your neighborhood in Brooklyn !  We had the Ravioli and the Egg Plant Parmesan... Can you say amazing !!  Well cooked , fresh and flavorful taste .... We even shared a slice of "Juniors Cheesecake ". Can not wait to go back !!!

data.title: Home cooked meal
data.text: The family and I were looking for a local mom and pop. Well we found it at Bruno's of Brooklyn. The wife enjoyed greeting and carring for us as if we just arrived at her private home while the husband cooked away. Also a very nice guy. We were a party of 8 including 2 children. The food was outstanding. No pictures to post. No need. Call ahead. Eat there even if it's outside.

data.title: Have now been there four times. Can't wait for the fifth.
data.text: Atmosphere is awesome- small- like being in NYC. Owners are not only really nice people but amazing restauranteurs. You gotta have the rice balls!! Their bolognaise is the best I have ever had!!

data.title: OMG !! SO GOOD
data.text: Small and off the beaten path, but next to the Verandah Restaurant, this little gem is a treasure with homemade pasta to delight your palate. We sat on the "patio", actually a narrow outside concrete path beside the building. Our meals were delicious and they were very accommodating to our friend who has food allergies.  True Italian flavors and menu.  SO GOOD !!

data.title: Great food, wonderful service
data.text:
OK, this place is the real deal. It is what you would imagine if you were asked to think of a small Italian restaurant in the middle of Brooklyn. My wife and I, accompanied by our son and his girlfriend, went there last night for dinner. When we walked in it was the delicious smell that hit me, along with the bustle and energy of the place. I knew I was in for a treat.

Our hostess/waitress, Genevieve, is in fact the wife of the chef, Cal Bruno - yes this place is run and worked by a husband and wife team. Genevieve is a lovely lady who never stopped moving. When she described the wine to us it was with a passion from a lady who loves wine, her recommendations were delicious. When she described the food it was with serious pride, and she had a lot to be proud of - the food was fantastic. She also had visible pride in her husband, who was cooking furiously in the kitchen - but he took the time to smile and wave at us.

We started off with Calamari, which was cooked to perfection, and I really mean perfect! This was paired very well with a nice bottle of Chianti. We ordered our entrees and everybody ordered something different; my wife ordered the Sausage and Peppers, my son the Lasagne and Meatballs, his girlfriend the Ravioli and Meatballs and I asked Genevieve to pick something out for me. She smiled, asked me if I liked veal (I answered yes), and she nodded her head. We ordered more wine. The food arrived, hot and fresh off the stove. It was very, very good Italian food; it was all delicious. I had the Veal Chop, which was, like the rest of the food, delicious. I admit that I really love Sausage and Peppers and Bruno's version of this dish was possibly the best I ever had.

The Espressos after dinner were very well made, and I like a good espresso. Genevieve brought over a sample of some Cannoli Cake her husband had made fresh... all I can say is WOW! 

The whole meal was great. We were all very impressed. Cal and Genevieve were friendly and gracious hosts. We will be back.

data.title: Awesome Italian Restaurant
data.text: This authentic, cozy Italian restaurant is fabulous! The service is terrific and friendly. The homemade pasta is superb - everything on the menu is excellent! Can't wait to go back and I highly recommend it.

data.title: I finally found my Italian restaurant!
data.text: We had a wonderful meal here last night. They had one osso bucco special left. Glad I snared it. It was absolutely delicious, served with house made pappardelle pasta. My husband had the penne pasta with vodka sauce with shrimp. Also delicious. The place is teeny tiny, but we enjoyed sitting at the counter watching the chefs do their thing. The pappardelle with broccoli rabe and Italian sausage looked great--I'll be having that the next time we go. Limoncello mascarpone with sponge cake for dessert. Mighty yummy, but I was craving Torta della Nonna. They didn't have it as they were getting ready to close for 3 weeks vacation. Not to worry, we'll be back to sample it. Very nice, professional service. Friendly people. I felt I was in somebody's home kitchen.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Real Italian- loved watching the cook- had the chicken parm-could cut it with my fork and the sauce was perfect. Quaint-small and amazing.

data.title: Great find for a wonderful supper
data.text: Now this is Italian as I remember growing up in New York. Small intimate restaurant we were fortunate to me served without a reservation. Homemade pasta in their Sicilian signature red sauce was some of the best I've had. The chicken dish my wife has also received rave reviews. Fresh Italian bread and a robust salad complimented our meal. And don't forget to finish it off with scrumptious canoli!

data.title: The Best
data.text: We've been here a few times for dinner and absolutely love it. They have a fantastic menu with all the authentic favorites you love. We've had everything from fish to chicken to pasta to dessert and believe me when I say it's all good. If you're looking for the real deal Italian restaurant, this one is right out of Brooklyn. Give it a try. You wont be disappointed.
